intro: Exacum courtallense var. laxiflorum, commonly known as the Malabar violet, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact size and long-lasting blooms.
